member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel
member.summary: Performs an animation and renders a skinned model.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Pose
member.summary: Contains the snapshot of the animated model pose.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Pose.Bones
member.summary: The per-bone final transformations in actor world-space.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Pose.GetBonePosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the position of the bone in the actor local space.
member.returns: The bone position.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode
member.summary: Describes the animation graph updates frequency for the animated model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.Auto
member.summary: The automatic updates will be used (based on platform capabilities, distance to the player, etc.).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.EveryUpdate
member.summary: Animation will be updated every game update.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.EverySecondUpdate
member.summary: Animation will be updated every second game update.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.EveryFourthUpdate
member.summary: Animation will be updated every fourth game update.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.Manual
member.summary: Animation can be updated manually by the user scripts. Use method.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationUpdateMode.Never
member.summary: Animation won't be updated at all.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel._parametersHash
member.summary: Helper value used to keep parameters collection in sync with actual backend data.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Parameters
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation graph parameters collection.
member.remarks: It's null or empty if the property is null or asset is not loaded yet. It's highly recommended to use and cache the returned object to improve your game logic performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Entries
member.summary: Gets the skinned model entries collection. Each contains data how to render meshes using this entry (material, shadows casting, etc.).
member.remarks: It's null if the property is null or asset is not loaded yet.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.GetParam(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the parameter by index.
member.returns: The material parameter.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.GetParam(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the parameter by name.
member.returns: The animation graph parameter.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.GetParam(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the parameter by ID.
member.returns: The animation graph parameter.

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.EntriesChanged
member.summary: Occurs when entries collection gets changed. It's called on skinned model changed or when model asset gets reloaded, etc.

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ParametersChanged
member.summary: Occurs when animation graph parameters collection gets changed. It's called on animation graph asset changed or when graph asset gets reloaded, etc.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.GetCurrentPose(FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.Pose@)
member.summary: Gets the current animated skeleton pose. Will allocate the bone transformation array memory or reuse the cached one.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.SkinnedModel
member.summary: Gets or sets a skinned model asset used for rendering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.AnimationGraph
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation graph used for the skinned mesh skeleton bones evaluation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.PerBoneMotionBlur
member.summary: If true, use per-bone motion blur on this skeletal model. It requires additional rendering, can be disabled to save performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UseTimeScale
member.summary: If true, animation speed will be affected by the global time scale parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the animation will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the animations themselves will also stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation update mode. Can be used to optimize the performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.BoundsScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the master scale parameter for the actor bounding box. Helps reducing mesh flickering effect on screen edges.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.CustomBounds
member.summary: Gets or sets the custom bounds (in actor local space). If set to empty bounds then source skinned model bind pose bounds will be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ShadowsMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadows casting mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.RootMotionTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets the animation root motion apply target. If not specified the animated model will apply it itself.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.UpdateAnimation
member.summary: Performs the full animation update.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.ResetAnimation
member.summary: Resets the animation state (clears the instance state data but preserves the instance parameters values).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AnimatedModel.GetMaterial(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets material used to render mesh at given index (overriden by model instance buffer or model default).
member.returns: Material or null if not assigned.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AudioListener
member.summary: Represents a listener that hears audio sources. For spatial audio the volume and pitch of played audio is determined by the distance, orientation and velocity differences between the source and the listener.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioListener.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioListener.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AudioSource
member.summary: Represents a source for emitting audio. Audio can be played spatially (gun shot), or normally (music). Each audio source must have an AudioClip to play - back, and it can also have a position in the case of spatial(3D) audio.
member.remarks: Whether or not an audio source is spatial is controlled by the assigned AudioClip.The volume and the pitch of a spatial audio source is controlled by its position and the AudioListener's position/direction/velocity.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.States
member.summary: Valid states in which AudioSource can be in.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.States.Playing
member.summary: The source is currently playing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.States.Paused
member.summary: The source is currently paused (play will resume from paused point).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.States.Stopped
member.summary: The source is currently stopped (play will resume from start).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Clip
member.summary: Gets or sets the audio clip asset used as a source of the sound.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume of the audio played from this source, in [0, 1] range.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Pitch
member.summary: Gets or sets the pitch of the played audio. The default is 1.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.IsLooping
member.summary: Determines whether the audio clip should loop when it finishes playing.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.PlayOnStart
member.summary: Determines whether the audio clip should auto play on level start.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.MinDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum distance at which audio attenuation starts. When the listener is closer to the source than this value, audio is heard at full volume. Once farther away the audio starts attenuating.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Attenuation
member.summary: Gets or sets the attenuation that controls how quickly does audio volume drop off as the listener moves further from the source.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Play
member.summary: Starts playing the currently assigned audio clip.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Pause
member.summary: Pauses the audio playback.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Stop
member.summary: Stops audio playback, rewinding it to the start.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.State
member.summary: Gets the the current state of the audio playback (playing/paused/stopped).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.AudioSource.Time
member.summary: Gets or sets the current time of playback. If playback hasn't yet started, it specifies the time at which playback will start at. The time is in seconds, in range [0, ClipLength].

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Camera
member.summary: Describes the camera projection and view. Provides information about how to render scene (viewport location and direction, etc.).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Camera.MainCamera
member.summary: Gets the current main camera used for scene rendering by . May be null if no camera is available.
member.remarks: If you override the main camera remember to remove the reference on object destroy or scene unload to prevent leaks and crashes.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Camera.ProjectPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3@,FlaxEngine.Vector2@)
member.summary: Projects the point from 3D world-space to the camera screen-space (in screen pixels for default viewport calculated from ).
member.param: The input world-space location (XYZ in world).
The output screen-space location (XY in screen pixels).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Camera.ConvertMouseToRay(FlaxEngine.Vector2)
member.summary: Converts the mouse location (in screen-space) to 3D ray.
member.returns: The mouse ray (world-space).

member.summary: Converts the mouse location (in screen-space) to 3D ray.

member.summary: Converts the mouse location (in screen-space) to 3D ray.
member.param: The custom viewport used for the camera projection matrices calculations.

member.summary: Calculates the view and the projection matrices for the camera. Support using custom viewport.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Camera.GetMatrices(FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Matrix@,FlaxEngine.Viewport@)
member.summary: Calculates the view and the projection matrices for the camera. Support using custom viewport.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CollisionDelegate
member.summary: Function delegate used for the collision events.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.TriggerDelegate
member.summary: Function delegate used for the trigger events.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Collider
member.summary: A base class for all colliders.

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.Collider.CollisionEnter
member.summary: Occurs when a collision start gets registered for this collider (it collides with something).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.Collider.CollisionExit
member.summary: Occurs when a collision end gets registered for this collider (it ends colliding with something).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.Collider.TriggerEnter
member.summary: Occurs when a trigger touching start gets registered for this collider (the other collider enters it and triggers the event).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.Collider.TriggerExit
member.summary: Occurs when a trigger touching end gets registered for this collider (the other collider enters it and triggers the event).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this collider.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,System.Single@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this collider.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The raycast result hit position distance from the ray origin. Valid only if raycast hits anything.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.RayCast(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.RayCastHit@,System.Single)
member.summary: Performs a raycast against this collider, returns results in a RaycastHit structure.
member.param: The normalized direction of the ray.
The result hit information. Valid only when method returns true.
The maximum distance the ray should check for collisions.
member.returns: True if ray hits an object, otherwise false.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Collider.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Gets a point on the collider that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
member.returns: The result point on the collider that is closest to the specified location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.IsTrigger
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'IsTrigger' flag.
member.remarks: A trigger doesn't register a collision with an incoming Rigidbody. Instead, it sends OnTriggerEnter, OnTriggerExit and OnTriggerStay message when a rigidbody enters or exits the trigger volume.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.Center
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the collider, measured in the object's local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.ContactOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the contact offset.
member.remarks: Colliders whose distance is less than the sum of their ContactOffset values will generate contacts. The contact offset must be positive. Contact offset allows the collision detection system to predictively enforce the contact constraint even when the objects are slightly separated.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.Material
member.summary: Gets or sets the physical material used by this collider.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Collider.AttachedRigidBody
member.summary: Gets the attached rigidbody.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog
member.summary: Used to create fogging effects such as clouds but with a density that is related to the height of the fog.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogDensity
member.summary: Gets or sets the fog density factor. Range: 0-0.6.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogInscatteringColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogBaseHeightOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the offset from the fog object height where fog starts.
member.remarks: It's a bottom level of the fog where it has density equal 1 (fully dense). This parameter controls the height of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogTopHeightDensity
member.summary: Gets or sets the fog density factor at top height level.
member.remarks: Should be close to 0. It get's scaled by the global density parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogMaxOpacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum opacity of the fog.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.StartDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from the camera that the fog will start, in world units.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.FogCutoffDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance past which scene elements will have no fog applied. Use value 0 to disable it.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringLight
member.summary: Gets or sets the light used for Directional Inscattering.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringExponent
member.summary: Gets or sets the side of the directional inscattering cone.
member.remarks: Note: there must be a directional light enabled for Directional Inscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringStartDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the start distance from the viewer of the directional inscattering.
member.remarks: Note: there must be a directional light enabled for Directional Inscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.DirectionalInscatteringColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color of the directional inscattering.
member.remarks: Note: there must be a directional light enabled for Directional Inscattering to be used.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEnable
member.summary: Whether to enable Volumetric fog.
member.remarks: Graphics quality settings control the resolution of the fog simulation.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogScatteringDistribution
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that controls the scattering phase function - how much incoming light scatters in various directions.
member.remarks: A distribution value of 0 scatters equally in all directions, while 0.9 scatters predominantly in the light direction. In order to have visible volumetric fog light shafts from the side, the distribution will need to be closer to 0. Range: -0.9-0.9.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogAlbedo
member.summary: Gets or sets the height fog particle reflectiveness used by volumetric fog.
member.remarks: Water particles in air have an albedo near white, while dust has slightly darker value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogEmissive
member.summary: Gets or sets the light emitted by height fog.
member.remarks: This is a density so more light is emitted the further you are looking through the fog. In most cases using a Skylight is a better choice, however, it may be useful in certain scenarios.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogExtinctionScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale of the height fog particles extinction.
member.remarks: Values larger than 1 cause fog particles everywhere absorb more light. Range: 0.1-10.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ExponentialHeightFog.VolumetricFogDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance over which volumetric fog should be computed.
member.remarks: Larger values extend the effect into the distance but expose under-sampling artifacts in details.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.ScalingModes.LockXY
member.summary: The lock XY plane axis. Axes X and Y are constrained to-gather and axis Z is free.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.ScalingModes.LockYZ
member.summary: The lock YZ plane axis. Axes Y and Z are constrained to-gather and axis X is free.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.CullDistance
member.summary: The per-instance cull distance.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.CullDistanceRandomRange
member.summary: The per-instance cull distance randomization range (randomized per instance and added to master CullDistance value).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.ShadowsMode
member.summary: The shadows casting mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintDensity
member.summary: The foliage instances density defined in instances count per 1000x1000 units area.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintRadius

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintGroundSlopeAngleMin
member.summary: The minimum ground slope angle to paint foliage on it (in degrees).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintGroundSlopeAngleMax
member.summary: The maximum ground slope angle to paint foliage on it (in degrees).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintScaling
member.summary: The scaling mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintScaleMin
member.summary: The scale minimum values per axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PaintScaleMax
member.summary: The scale maximum values per axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PlacementOffsetY
member.summary: The per-instance random offset range on axis Y.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PlacementRandomPitchAngle
member.summary: The random pitch angle range (uniform in both ways around normal vector).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.PlacementRandomRollAngle
member.summary: The random roll angle range (uniform in both ways around normal vector).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.DensityScalingScale
member.summary: The density scaling scale applied to the global scale for the foliage instances of this type. Can be used to boost or reduce density scaling effect on this foliage type. Default is 1.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Foliage.TypeOptions.ReceiveDecals
member.summary: Determines whenever this meshes can receive decals.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Joint

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakForce

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.BreakTorque

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Joint.TargetAnchorRotation

member.remarks: This is the relative pose rotation which locates the joint frame relative to the target actor.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.NavLink

An off-mesh connection is a user defined traversable connection made up to two vertices, at least one of which resides within a navigation mesh polygon allowing movement outside the navigation mesh.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.ParticleEffect.UpdateWhenOffscreen
member.summary: If true, the particle simulation will be updated even when an actor cannot be seen by any camera. Otherwise, the simulation will stop running when the actor is off-screen.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.RigidBody
member.summary: Physics simulation driven object.

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CollisionEnter
member.summary: Occurs when a collision start gets registered for one of the colliders attached to this rigidbody (it collides with something).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CollisionExit
member.summary: Occurs when a collision end gets registered for one of the colliders attached to this rigidbody (it ends colliding with something).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.TriggerEnter
member.summary: Occurs when a trigger touching start gets registered for one of the colliders attached to this rigidbody (the other collider enters it and triggers the event).

member.name: E:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.TriggerExit
member.summary: Occurs when a trigger touching end gets registered for one of the colliders attached to this rigidbody (the other collider enters it and triggers the event).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.ClosestPoint(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Gets a point on one of the colliders attached to the attached that is closest to a given location. Can be used to find a hit location or position to apply explosion force or any other special effects.
member.param: The position to find the closest point to it.
member.returns: The result point on the rigidbody shape that is closest to the specified location.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsKinematic
member.summary: Enables kinematic mode for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
Kinematic rigidbodies are special dynamic actors that are not influenced by forces(such as gravity), and have no momentum. They are considered to have infinite mass and can push regular dynamic actors out of the way.Kinematics will not collide with static or other kinematic objects.
Kinematic rigidbodies are great for moving platforms or characters, where direct motion control is desired.
Kinematic rigidbodies are incompatible with CCD.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableSimulation
member.summary: If true simulation and collisions detection will be enabled for the rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UseCCD
member.summary: If true Continuous Collision Detection (CCD) will be used for this object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.EnableGravity
member.summary: If object should have the force of gravity applied.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.StartAwake
member.summary: If object should start awake, or if it should initially be sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce linear movement.
member.remarks: Linear damping can be used to slow down an object. The higher the drag the more the object slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularDamping
member.summary: Gets or sets the 'drag' force added to reduce angular movement.
member.remarks: Angular damping can be used to slow down the rotation of an object. The higher the drag the more the rotation slows down.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxAngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum angular velocity that a simulated object can achieve.
member.remarks: The angular velocity of rigidbodies is clamped to MaxAngularVelocity to avoid numerical instability with fast rotating bodies. Because this may prevent intentional fast rotations on objects such as wheels, you can override this value per rigidbody.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.OverrideMass
member.summary: Override the auto computed mass.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Mass
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass value measured in kilograms (use override value only if EnableOverrideMass is enabled).
member.remarks: The object mass value is computed from the density and attached colliders (taking into account other parameters like MassScale). Use may override it by enabling OverrideMass and providing a custom value. Setting this property automatically overrides the calculated value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MassScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the per-instance scaling of the mass.
member.remarks: Used only for auto computed mass, not the overriden value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.UpdateMassWhenScaleChanges
member.summary: If true, it will update mass when actor scale changes.
member.remarks: Used only when mass is not being overriden.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMassOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the user specified offset for the center of mass of this object, from the calculated location.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Constraints
member.summary: Gets or sets the object movement constraint flags that define degrees of freedom are allowed for the simulation of object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.LinearVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the linear velocity of the rigidbody.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AngularVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the angular velocity of the rigidbody measured in radians per second.
member.remarks: It's used mostly to get the current angular velocity. Manual modifications may result in unrealistic behaviour.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.MaxDepenetrationVelocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depenetration velocity when rigidbody moving out of penetrating state.
member.remarks: This value controls how much velocity the solver can introduce to correct for penetrations in contacts. Using this property can smooth objects moving out of colliding state and prevent unstable motion.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SleepThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the mass-normalized kinetic energy threshold below which an actor may go to sleep.
member.remarks: Actors whose kinetic energy divided by their mass is below this threshold will be candidates for sleeping.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.CenterOfMass
member.summary: Gets or sets the center of the mass in the local space.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.IsSleeping
member.summary: Determines whether this rigidbody is sleeping.
member.remarks: When an actor does not move for a period of time, it is no longer simulated in order to save time. This state is called sleeping. However, because the object automatically wakes up when it is either touched by an awake object, or one of its properties is changed by the user, the entire sleep mechanism should be transparent to the user.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.Sleep
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to sleep (for at least one frame).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.WakeUp
member.summary: Forces a rigidbody to wake up.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the world space to the rigidbody at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce a torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeForce(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies a force (or impulse) defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system) at its center of mass.
member.remarks:
This will not induce a torque
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an acceleration and a velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively. The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse mass and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The force/impulse to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the world space to the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the world space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.AddRelativeTorque(FlaxEngine.Vector3,FlaxEngine.ForceMode)
member.summary: Applies an impulsive torque defined in the local space of the rigidbody (relative to its coordinate system).
member.remarks:
ForceMode determines if the force is to be conventional or impulsive.
Each actor has an angular acceleration and an angular velocity change accumulator which are directly modified using the modes ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.The modes ForceMode.Force and ForceMode.Impulse also modify these same accumulators and are just short hand for multiplying the vector parameter by inverse inertia and then using ForceMode.Acceleration and ForceMode.VelocityChange respectively.
member.param: The torque to apply defined in the local space.
The mode to use when applying the force/impulse.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.RigidBody.SetSolverIterationCounts(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the solver iteration counts for the rigidbody.
member.remarks:
The solver iteration count determines how accurately joints and contacts are resolved. If you are having trouble with jointed bodies oscillating and behaving erratically, then setting a higher position iteration count may improve their stability.
If intersecting bodies are being depenetrated too violently, increase the number of velocity iterations. More velocity iterations will drive the relative exit velocity of the intersecting objects closer to the correct value given the restitution.
Default: 4 position iterations, 1 velocity iteration.
member.param: The minimum number of position iterations the solver should perform for this body.
The minimum number of velocity iterations the solver should perform for this body.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Scene.AssetTypename
member.summary: The scene asset typename. Type of the serialized scene asset data. Hidden class for the scene assets. Actors deserialization rules are strictly controlled under the hood by the C++ core parts. Mostly because scene asset has the same ID as scene root actor so loading both managed objects for scene asset and scene will crash (due to object ids conflict). This type does not exist in the engine assembly.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Single[],System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The height map. Each array item contains a height value (2D inlined array). It should has size equal (chunkSize*4+1)^2.
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchHeightMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Single*,System.Byte*,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Setups the terrain patch using the specified heightmap data.
member.param: The patch location (x and z coordinates).
The height map array length. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be equal (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.
The height map. Each array item contains a height value (2D inlined array).
The holes mask (optional). Normalized to 0-1 range values with holes mask per-vertex. Must match the heightmap dimensions.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

The zero-based index of the splatmap texture.

The splat map. Each array item contains 4 layer weights. It must match the terrain descriptor, so it should be (chunkSize*4+1)^2. Patch is a 4 by 4 square made of chunks. Each chunk has chunkSize quads on edge.

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Terrain.SetupPatchSplatMap(FlaxEngine.Int2@,System.Int32,System.Int32,FlaxEngine.Color32*,System.Boolean)

If set to true patch will use virtual storage by force. Otherwise it can use normal texture asset storage on drive (valid only during Editor). Runtime-created terrain can only use virtual storage (in RAM).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode
member.summary: The canvas rendering modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.ScreenSpace
member.summary: The screen space rendering mode that places UI elements on the screen rendered on top of the scene. If the screen is resized or changes resolution, the Canvas will automatically change size to match this.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.CameraSpace
member.summary: The camera space rendering mode that places Canvas in a given distance in front of a specified Camera. The UI elements are rendered by this camera, which means that the Camera settings affect the appearance of the UI. If the Camera is set to Perspective, the UI elements will be rendered with perspective, and the amount of perspective distortion can be controlled by the Camera Field of View. If the screen is resized, changes resolution, or the camera frustum changes, the Canvas will automatically change size to match as well.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderMode.WorldSpace
member.summary: The world space rendering mode that places Canvas as any other object in the scene. The size of the Canvas can be set manually using its Transform, and UI elements will render in front of or behind other objects in the scene based on 3D placement. This is useful for UIs that are meant to be a part of the world. This is also known as a "diegetic interface".

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CanvasRenderer

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType
member.summary: A storage data type.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.ConvexMesh
member.summary: A convex polyhedron represented as a set of vertices and polygonal faces. The number of vertices and faces of a convex mesh is limited to 255.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.CollisionDataType.TriangleMesh
member.summary: A collision triangle mesh consists of a collection of vertices and the triangle indices.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags
member.summary: Set of flags used to generate model convex mesh. Allows to customize process.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.None
member.summary: Nothing.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Disables the convex mesh validation to speed-up hull creation. Creating a convex mesh with invalid input data without prior validation may result in undefined behavior.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UsePlaneShifting
member.summary:
Enables plane shifting vertex limit algorithm.
Plane shifting is an alternative algorithm for the case when the computed hull has more vertices than the specified vertex limit.
The default algorithm computes the full hull, and an OBB around the input vertices. This OBB is then sliced with the hull planes until the vertex limit is reached. The default algorithm requires the vertex limit to be set to at least 8, and typically produces results that are much better quality than are produced by plane shifting.
When plane shifting is enabled, the hull computation stops when vertex limit is reached.The hull planes are then shifted to contain all input vertices, and the new plane intersection points are then used to generate the final hull with the given vertex limit.Plane shifting may produce sharp edges to vertices very far away from the input cloud, and does not guarantee that all input vertices are inside the resulting hull. However, it can be used with a vertex limit as low as 4.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.UseFastInteriaComputation
member.summary: Inertia tensor computation is faster using SIMD code, but the precision is lower, which may result in incorrect inertia for very thin hulls.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.ConvexMeshGenerationFlags.ShiftVertices
member.summary: Convex hull input vertices are shifted to be around origin to provide better computation stability. It is recommended to provide input vertices around the origin, otherwise use this flag to improve numerical stability.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.CollisionData

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.Model.Save(System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Saves asset to the file. It must be fully loaded.
member.remarks: Supported only in Editor. If you use saving with the GPU mesh data then the call has to be provided from the thread other than the main game thread.
member.param: True if save also GPU mesh buffers, otherwise will keep data in storage unmodified. Valid only if saving the same asset to the same location and it's loaded. If you use saving with the GPU mesh data then the call has to be provided from the thread other than the main game thread.
The custom asset path to use for the saving. Use empty value to save this asset to its own storage location. Can be used to duplicate model asset.
member.returns: True if cannot save data, otherwise false.

member.remarks: Supported only in Editor. If you use saving with the GPU mesh data then the call has to be provided from the thread other than the main game thread.
member.param: True if save also GPU mesh buffers, otherwise will keep data in storage unmodified. Valid only if saving the same asset to the same location and it's loaded. If you use saving with the GPU mesh data then the call has to be provided from the thread other than the main game thread.
The custom asset path to use for the saving. Use empty value to save this asset to its own storage location. Can be used to duplicate model asset.
member.returns: True if cannot save data, otherwise false.

member.summary: The character is colliding to the sides.

member.summary: The character has collision above.

member.summary: The character has collision below.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this characters is grounded.
member.remarks: Returns true is the CharacterController was touching the ground during the last move.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Radius
member.summary: Gets or sets the radius of the character capsule, measured in the object's local space.
member.remarks: The character capsule radius will be scaled by the actor's world scale.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the character, measured in the object's local space.
member.remarks: The character height will be scaled by the actor's world scale.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.SlopeLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the slope limit (in degrees).
member.remarks: Limits the collider to only climb slopes that are less steep (in degrees) than the indicated value.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.StepOffset
member.summary: Gets or sets the step height.
member.remarks: The character will step up a stair only if it is closer to the ground than the indicated value. This should not be greater than the Character Controller's height or it will generate an error.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.MinMoveDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum move distance of the character controller.
member.remarks: The minimum travelled distance to consider. If travelled distance is smaller, the character doesn't move. This is used to stop the recursive motion algorithm when remaining distance to travel is small.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Velocity
member.summary: Gets the current linear velocity of the Character Controller.
member.remarks: This allows tracking how fast the character is actually moving, for instance when it is stuck at a wall this value will be the near zero vector.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Flags
member.summary: Gets the current collision flags.
member.remarks: Tells which parts of the character capsule collided with the environment during the last move call. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.SimpleMove(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character with the given speed.
member.remarks: Velocity along the y-axis is ignored and the gravity is automatically applied. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.CharacterController.Move(FlaxEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Moves the character with the given speed.
member.remarks: Velocity along the y-axis is ignored and the gravity is automatically applied. It will slide along colliders. Result collision flags is the summary of collisions that occurred during the Move.
member.returns: The collision flags. It can be used to trigger various character animations.

member.summary: Movement on the X axis.

member.summary: Movement on the Y axis.

member.summary: Movement on the Z axis.

member.summary: Rotation around the X axis.

member.summary: Rotation around the Y axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointAxis.SwingZ
member.summary: Rotation around the Z axis.

member.summary: Specifies type of constraint placed on a specific axis.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointMotion.Locked
member.summary: Axis is immovable.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointMotion.Limited
member.summary: Axis will be constrained by the specified limits.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointMotion.Free
member.summary: Axis will not be constrained.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType
member.summary: Type of drives that can be used for moving or rotating bodies attached to the joint.
member.remarks:
Each drive is an implicit force-limited damped spring: force = spring * (target position - position) + damping * (targetVelocity - velocity)
Alternatively, the spring may be configured to generate a specified acceleration instead of a force.
A linear axis is affected by drive only if the corresponding drive flag is set.There are two possible models for angular drive : swing / twist, which may be used to drive one or more angular degrees of freedom, or slerp, which may only be used to drive all three angular degrees simultaneously.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.X
member.summary: Linear movement on the X axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Y
member.summary: Linear movement on the Y axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Z
member.summary: Linear movement on the Z axis using the linear drive model.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Swing
member.summary: Rotation around the Y axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Twist
member.summary: Rotation around the Z axis using the twist/swing angular drive model. Should not be used together with Slerp mode.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDriveType.Slerp
member.summary: Rotation using spherical linear interpolation. Uses the SLERP angular drive mode which performs rotation by interpolating the quaternion values directly over the shortest path (applies to all three axes, which they all must be unlocked).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive
member.summary: Specifies parameters for a drive that will attempt to move the joint bodies to the specified drive position and velocity.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Stiffness
member.summary: The spring strength. Force proportional to the position error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Damping
member.summary: Damping strength. Force proportional to the velocity error.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.ForceLimit
member.summary: The maximum force the drive can apply.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Acceleration
member.summary: If true the drive will generate acceleration instead of forces. Acceleration drives are easier to tune as they account for the masses of the actors to which the joint is attached.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.Default
member.summary: The default structure.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6JointDrive.#ctor(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: if set to true the drive will generate acceleration instead of forces.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.D6Joint
member.summary: Physics joint that is the most customizable type of joint. This joint type can be used to create all other built-in joint types, and to design your own custom ones, but is less intuitive to use. Allows a specification of a linear constraint (for example for a slider), twist constraint (rotating around X) and swing constraint (rotating around Y and Z). It also allows you to constrain limits to only specific axes or completely lock specific axes.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.#ctor
member.summary: Creates new object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.New
member.summary: Creates new instance of object.
member.returns: Created object.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.D6Joint.GetMotion(FlaxEngine.D6JointAxis)
member.summary: Gets the motion type around the specified axis.
member.remarks: Each axis may independently specify that the degree of freedom is locked (blocking relative movement along or around this axis), limited by the corresponding limit, or free.
member.param: The axis the degree of freedom around which the motion type is specified.
member.returns: The value.

member.summary: Sets the motion type around the specified axis.
member.remarks: Each axis may independently specify that the degree of freedom is locked (blocking relative movement along or around this axis), limited by the corresponding limit, or free.
member.param: The axis the degree of freedom around which the motion type is specified.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.SphericalJoint
member.summary: Physics joint that removes all translational degrees of freedom but allows all rotational degrees of freedom. Essentially this ensures that the anchor points of the two bodies are always coincident. Bodies are allowed to rotate around the anchor points, and their rotation can be limited by an elliptical cone.

member.remarks: Determines a limit that constrains the movement of the joint to a specific minimum and maximum distance. You must enable the limit flag on the joint in order for this to be recognized.

member.summary: Graphics feature levels indicates what level of support can be relied upon. They are named after the graphics API to indicate the minimum level of the features set to support. Feature levels are ordered from the lowest to the most high-end so feature level enum can be used to switch between feature levels (e.g. don't use geometry shader if not supported).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.FeatureLevel.SM5
member.summary: The features set defined by the core capabilities of DirectX 11 Shader Model 5.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MainRenderTask
member.summary: The main game rendering task used by the engine.
member.remarks: For Main Render Task its may be null because game can be rendered directly to the native window backbuffer. This allows to increase game rendering performance (reduced memory usage and data transfer). User should use post effects pipeline to modify the final frame.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MainRenderTask.Instance
member.summary: Gets the main game rendering task. Use it to plug custom rendering logic for your game.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain
member.summary: Material domain type. Material domain defines the target usage of the material shader.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.Surface
member.summary: The surface material. Can be used to render the scene geometry including models and skinned models.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.PostProcess
member.summary: The post process material. Can be used to perform custom post-processing of the rendered frame.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.Decal
member.summary: The deferred decal material. Can be used to apply custom overlay or surface modifications to the object surfaces in the world.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.GUI
member.summary: The GUI shader. Can be used to draw custom control interface elements or to add custom effects to the GUI.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.Terrain
member.summary: The terrain shader. Can be used only with landscape chunks geometry that use optimized vertex data and support multi-layered blending.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialDomain.Particle
member.summary: The particle shader. Can be used only with particles geometry (sprites, trails and ribbons). Supports reading particle data on a GPU.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialBlendMode
member.summary: Material blending modes.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialBlendMode.Opaque
member.summary: The opaque material. Used during GBuffer pass rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialBlendMode.Transparent
member.summary: The transparent material. Used during Forward pass rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialBlendMode.Additive
member.summary: The additive blend. Material color is used to add to color of the objects behind the surface. Used during Forward pass rendering.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialBlendMode.Multiply
member.summary: The multiply blend. Material color is used to multiply color of the objects behind the surface. Used during Forward pass rendering.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialShadingModel
member.summary: Material shading models. Defines how material inputs and properties are combined to result the final surface color.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialShadingModel.Unlit
member.summary: The unlit material. Emissive channel is used as an output color. Can perform custom lighting operations or just glow. Won't be affected by the lighting pipeline.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialShadingModel.Lit
member.summary: The default lit material. The most common choice for the material surfaces.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.MaterialShadingModel.Subsurface
member.summary: The subsurface material. Intended for materials like vax or skin that need light scattering to transport simulation through the object.

member.summary: A four-component, 128-bit floating-point format that supports 32 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G32B32A32_UInt
member.summary: A four-component, 128-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 32 bits per channel including alpha.

member.summary: A four-component, 64-bit floating-point format that supports 16 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R16G16B16A16_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 64-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format that supports 16 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R16G16B16A16_UInt
member.summary: A four-component, 64-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 16 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R16G16B16A16_SNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 64-bit signed-normalized-integer format that supports 16 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R16G16B16A16_SInt
member.summary: A four-component, 64-bit signed-integer format that supports 16 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G32_Typeless
member.summary: A two-component, 64-bit typeless format that supports 32 bits for the red channel and 32 bits for the green channel.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G32_Float
member.summary: A two-component, 64-bit floating-point format that supports 32 bits for the red channel and 32 bits for the green channel.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G32_UInt
member.summary: A two-component, 64-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 32 bits for the red channel and 32 bits for the green channel.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G32_SInt
member.summary: A two-component, 64-bit signed-integer format that supports 32 bits for the red channel and 32 bits for the green channel.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32G8X24_Typeless
member.summary: A two-component, 64-bit typeless format that supports 32 bits for the red channel, 8 bits for the green channel, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.D32_Float_S8X24_UInt
member.summary: A 32-bit floating-point component, and two unsigned-integer components (with an additional 32 bits). This format supports 32-bit depth, 8-bit stencil, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R32_Float_X8X24_Typeless
member.summary: A 32-bit floating-point component, and two typeless components (with an additional 32 bits). This format supports 32-bit red channel, 8 bits are unused, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.X32_Typeless_G8X24_UInt
member.summary: A 32-bit typeless component, and two unsigned-integer components (with an additional 32 bits). This format has 32 bits unused, 8 bits for green channel, and 24 bits are unused.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R10G10B10A2_Typeless
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit typeless format that supports 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R10G10B10A2_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format that supports 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R10G10B10A2_UInt
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-integer format that supports 10 bits for each color and 2 bits for alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R11G11B10_Float
member.summary: Three partial-precision floating-point numbers encoded into a single 32-bit value (a variant of s10e5, which is sign bit, 10-bit mantissa, and 5-bit biased (15) exponent). There are no sign bits, and there is a 5-bit biased (15) exponent for each channel, 6-bit mantissa for R and G, and a 5-bit mantissa for B.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8_Typeless
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit typeless format that supports 8 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format that supports 8 bits per channel including alpha.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R8G8B8A8_UNorm_sRGB

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R9G9B9E5_SharedExp
member.summary: Three partial-precision floating-point numbers encoded into a single 32-bit value all sharing the same 5-bit exponent (variant of s10e5, which is sign bit, 10-bit mantissa, and 5-bit biased (15) exponent). There is no sign bit, and there is a shared 5-bit biased (15) exponent and a 9-bit mantissa for each channel.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.R8G8_B8G8_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the UYVY format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PixelFormat.G8R8_G8B8_UNorm
member.summary: A four-component, 32-bit unsigned-normalized-integer format. This packed RGB format is analogous to the YUY2 format. Each 32-bit block describes a pair of pixels: (R8, G8, B8) and (R8, G8, B8) where the R8/B8 values are repeated, and the G8 values are unique to each pixel. Width must be even.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation
member.summary: The Post Process effect rendering location within the rendering pipeline.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation.Default
member.summary: The default location after the in-build PostFx pass (bloom, color grading, etc.) but before anti-aliasing effect.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation.BeforePostProcessingPass
member.summary: The 'before' in-build PostFx pass (bloom, color grading, etc.). After Forward Pass (transparency) and fog effects.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation.BeforeForwardPass
member.summary: The 'before' Forward pass (transparency) and fog effects. After the Light pass and Reflections pass.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation.BeforeReflectionsPass
member.summary: The 'before' Reflections pass. After the Light pass. Can be used to affect Screen Space Reflections by the GUI.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffectLocation.AfterAntiAliasingPass
member.summary: The 'after' AA filter pass. Rendering is done to the output backbuffer.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffect
member.summary: Custom postFx which can modify final image by processing it with material based filters. The base class for all post process effects used by the graphics pipeline. Allows to extend frame rendering logic and apply custom effects such as outline, night vision, contrast etc.
member.remarks: Override this class and implement custom post fx logic. Use MainRenderTask.Instance.CustomPostFx.Add(myPostFx) to attach your script to rendering. Or add script to camera.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffect.CanRender
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this effect can be rendered.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffect.UseSingleTarget
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether use a single render target as both input and output. Use this if your effect doesn't need to copy the input buffer to the output but can render directly to the single texture. Can be used to optimize game performance.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffect.Location
member.summary: Gets the effect rendering location within rendering pipeline.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessEffect.Order
member.summary: Gets the effect rendering order. Registered post effects are sorted before rendering (from the lowest order to the highest order).

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether Depth of Field is enabled.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_BlurStrength
member.summary: Gets or sets the blur intensity in the out-of-focus areas. Allows reducing blur amount by scaling down the Gaussian Blur radius. Normalized to range 0-1.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_FocalDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in World Units from the camera that acts as the center of the region where the scene is perfectly in focus and no blurring occurs.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_FocalRegion
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in World Units beyond the focal distance where the scene is perfectly in focus and no blurring occurs.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_NearTransitionRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in World Units from the focal region on the side nearer to the camera over which the scene transitions from focused to blurred.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_FarTransitionRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in World Units from the focal region on the side farther from the camera over which the scene transitions from focused to blurred.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_DepthLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance in World Units which describes border after that there is no blur (useful to disable DoF on sky). Use 0 to disable that feature.

member.summary: Enables/disables generating Bokeh shapes.

member.summary: Controls Bokeh shapes maximum size.

member.summary: Gets or sets the Bokeh shapes style.

member.summary: Gets or sets the custom texture for bokeh shapes.

member.summary: Controls Bokeh shapes generating minimum pixel brightness to appear.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_BokehBlurThreshold
member.summary: Controls Bokeh shapes blur threshold.

member.summary: Controls Bokeh shapes brightness falloff parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.DOF_BokehDepthCutoff
member.summary: Controls Bokeh shapes depth cutoff parameter.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_Intensity
member.summary: Gets or sets the effect intensity (normalized to range [0;1]). Use 0 to disable it.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_DepthResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the input depth resolution mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_RayTracePassResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the ray trace pass resolution mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_BRDFBias
member.summary: Gets or sets the BRDF bias. This value controls source roughness effect on reflections blur. Smaller values produce wider reflections spread but also introduce more noise. Higher values provide more mirror-like reflections. Default value is 0.8.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_RoughnessThreshold
member.summary: Minimum allowed surface roughness value to use local reflections. Pixels with higher values won't be affected by the effect.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_WorldAntiSelfOcclusionBias
member.summary: Ray tracing starting position is offset by a percent of the normal in world space to avoid self occlusions.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_ResolvePassResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolve pass resolution mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_ResolveSamples
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolve pass samples amount. Higher values provide better quality but reduce effect performance. Default value is 4. Use 1 for the highest speed.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_EdgeFadeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the edge fade factor. It's used to fade off effect on screen edges to provide smoother image.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_UseColorBufferMips
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use color buffer mipmaps chain; otherwise will use raw input color buffer to sample reflections color. Using mipmaps improves resolve pass performance and reduces GPU cache misses.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_TemporalEffect
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether use temporal effect to smooth reflections.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_TemporalScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the temporal effect scale. Default is 8.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.SSR_TemporalResponse
member.summary: Gets or sets the temporal response. Default is 0.8.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.TrackBallEditorTypename
member.summary: The track ball editor typename used for color grading knobs. Use custom editor alias because FlaxEditor assembly is not referenced by the FlaxEngine.

member.summary: Gets or sets the motion blur effect scale.

member.summary: Gets or sets the motion vectors texture resolution. Motion blur uses per-pixel motion vectors buffer that contains objects movement information. Use lowe resolution to improve performance.

member.summary: Gets or sets the anti-aliasing effect mode.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.AA_TAA_JitterSpread
member.summary: Gets or sets the diameter (in texels) inside which jitter samples are spread. Smaller values result in crisper but more aliased output, while larger values result in more stable but blurrier output.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.AA_TAA_Sharpness
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of sharpening applied to the color buffer. High values may introduce dark-border artifacts.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.AA_TAA_StationaryBlending
member.summary: Gets or sets the blend coefficient for a stationary fragment. Controls the percentage of history sample blended into the final color.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Rendering.PostProcessSettings.AA_TAA_MotionBlending
member.summary: Gets or sets the blend coefficient for a fragment with significant motion. Controls the percentage of history sample blended into the final color.

member.summary: The direction of the view.

member.summary: The view matrix.

member.summary: The projection matrix.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.NonJitteredProjection
member.summary: The projection matrix with no camera offset (no jittering). For many temporal image effects, the camera that is currently rendering needs to be slightly offset from the default projection (that is, the camera is jittered). If you use motion vectors and camera jittering together, use this property to keep the motion vectors stable between frames.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.TemporalAAJitter
member.summary: The temporal AA jitter packed (xy - this frame jitter, zw - previous frame jitter). Cached before rendering. Zero if TAA is disabled. The value added to projection matrix (in clip space).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.IsOfflinePass
member.summary: Flag used by static, offline rendering passes (eg. reflections rendering, lightmap rendering etc.)

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.MaxShadowsQuality
member.summary: Maximum allowed shadows quality for this view

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.ModelLODBias
member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the render view.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.ModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the render view. Higher values increase LODs quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.ShadowModelLODBias
member.summary: The model LOD bias. Default is 0. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Rendering.RenderView.ShadowModelLODDistanceFactor
member.summary: The model LOD distance scale factor. Default is 1. Applied to all the objects in the shadow maps render views. Higher values increase LODs quality. Can be used to improve shadows rendering performance or increase quality.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Input
member.summary: The interface to get input information from Flax.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.Name
member.summary: The action "friendly name" used to access it from code.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.Mode
member.summary: The trigger mode. Allows to specify when input event should be fired.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.Key
member.summary: The keyboard key to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.MouseButton
member.summary: The mouse button to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.GampadButton
member.summary: The gamepad button to map for this action. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionConfig.Gamepad
member.summary: Which gamepad should be used.

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Name
member.summary: The axis "friendly name" used to access it from code.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Axis
member.summary: The axis type (mouse, gamepad, etc.).

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Gamepad
member.summary: Which gamepad should be used.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.PositiveButton
member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in positive direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.NegativeButton
member.summary: The button to be pressed for movement in negative direction. Use to ignore it.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.DeadZone
member.summary: Any positive or negative values that are less than this number will register as zero. Useful for gamepads to specify the deadzone.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Sensitivity
member.summary: For keyboard input, a larger value will result in faster response time (in units/s). A lower value will be more smooth. For Mouse delta the value will scale the actual mouse delta.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Gravity
member.summary: For keyboard input describes how fast will the input recenter. Speed (in units/s) that output value will rest to neutral value if not when device at rest.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Scale
member.summary: Additional scale parameter applied to the axis value. Allows to invert it or modify the range.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisConfig.Snap
member.summary: If enabled, the axis value will be immediately reset to zero after it receives opposite inputs. For keyboard input only.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.ActionMappings
member.summary: Maps a discrete button or key press events to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to event-driven behavior. The end effect is that pressing (and/or releasing) a key, mouse button, or keypad button.
member.remarks: Allocates the memory on get. Use and to reduce dynamic memory allocations.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Input.AxisMappings
member.summary: Maps keyboard, controller, or mouse inputs to a "friendly name" that will later be bound to continuous game behavior, such as movement. The inputs mapped in AxisMappings are continuously polled, even if they are just reporting that their input value.
member.remarks: Allocates the memory on get. Use and to reduce dynamic memory allocations.

member.returns: The amount of mappings.

member.summary: Gets the amount of assigned axis mappings.
member.returns: The amount of mappings.

member.summary: Gets the action mapping configuration.

member.summary: Gets the axis mapping configuration.

member.summary: Gets the value of the virtual axis identified by name. Use to get the current config.

member.summary: Gets the raw value of the virtual axis identified by name with no smoothing filtering applied. Use to get the current config.

member.summary: Gets time in seconds it took to complete the last frame in ticks, dependent

member.summary: Gets timeScale-independent time in seconds it took to complete the last frame in ticks.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.UnscaledGameTimeTicks

member.summary: Gets or sets the target amount of the game logic updates per second (script updates frequency).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.PhysicsFPS
member.summary: Gets or sets the target amount of the physics simulation updates per second (also fixed updates frequency).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.DrawFPS
member.summary: Gets or sets the target amount of the frames rendered per second (actual game FPS).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.TimeScale
member.summary: Gets or sets scale at which the time is passing. This can be used for slow motion effects.

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.GamePaused
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating whenever game logic is paused (physics, script updates, etc.).

member.name: P:FlaxEngine.Time.FramesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets the current Frames Per Second amount. User scripts updates or fixed updates for physics may run at a different frequency than scene rendering. Use this property to get an accurate amount of frames rendered during the last second.

member.name: M:FlaxEngine.TextureBase.Init(FlaxEngine.TextureBase.InitData)
member.summary: Initializes the texture storage container with the given data. Valid only for virtual assets. Can be used in both Editor and at runtime in a build game. It does not perform any data streaming or uploading to the GPU. Only the texture resource is being initialized and the data is copied to be streamed later.
member.remarks: Can be used only for virtual assets (see and ).

member.name: T:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum
member.summary: Enum defining preload data mode

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.Never
member.summary:
PersistentData will not be loaded automaticaly
Load has to be performed manually, or data will be set to default until overwritten

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.BeforeSceneLoad
member.summary: PersistentData will be loaded automaticaly before scene loading is performed
member.remarks: Most useful when scene requires some data from file. Same effect will be achieved when used

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.BeforeSceneLoadAsynchronus
member.summary: PersistentData will be loaded automaticaly before scene loading is performed.
member.remarks: Most of the scene initialization is performed, but object creation is waiting for data to be loaded

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.BeforeObjectInitialization
member.summary:
PersistentData will be loaded after scene is loaded and all objects on the scene are created and before Awake is executed
Most useful when object are initialized with persistant data but we want to include settings on first loading screen.
Same effect will be achieved when used

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.BeforeObjectInitializationAsynchronus
member.summary: PersistentData will be loaded after scene is loaded and all objects on the scene are created and before Awake is executed
member.remarks: Most useful when object are initialized with persistant data but we want to include settings on first loading screen.

member.name: F:FlaxEngine.PersistentDataConfig.PreloadSettingsEnum.OnFirstUse
member.summary: Persistent data is loaded before first Get or Save is used

member.summary: Determines if there is an intersection between the brush surface and a ray. If collision data is available on the CPU performs exact intersection check with the geometry. Otherwise performs simple vs test. For more efficient collisions detection and ray casting use physics.
